basics.name: Patrick Moody
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer
basics.summary: I’m Patrick, a civil engineer turned web developer from Adelaide, Australia. A few years ago, my wanderlust and love programming landed me in Silicon Valley... and I couldn’t be more excited! My experience is with the full Ruby and Javascript stack, both professionally and on countless side projects. I’ve built everything from a profitable WordPress theme creator, to HTML5 games, and web apps to increase my productivity. To view some of these projects (and play some games), check out: http://patmoody.com

work.summary: Verdigris is a high resolution energy monitoring system for commercial buildings. Using custom hardware sensors, real-time energy data (down the the device level) is visualized on the web dashboard.
highlights: Daily experience with the full tech stack of Ruby on Rails, Ember.js, Postgres, and Redis
Built real-time data visualization app to showcase product at a trade show booth
Took initiative to introduce to a continuous deployment process
Full ownership of new features, such as SMS/Email alerts
Extensive experience testing with Rspec, fixing bugs, optimization

work.summary: SaaS web app that takes an existing website and creates a matching WordPress theme. Created and run single handedly.
highlights: Successfully took the product from concept to profit
Full responsibility for all aspects, including product design, project management, development, marketing, customer support, and much more.
Split test marketing copy and sales flows
Managed customer support and affiliate relationships

work.summary: Full time contracting for e-commerce and internet marketing companies.
highlights: Self taught fundamental web skills HTML/CSS/Javascript/WordPress
Made hundreds of static websites, landing pages, WordPress
Proudly acquired marketing skills that engineers normally lack
Integrated payment gateways, PHP/Javascript plugins, etc

work.summary: Civil engineering consultancy specializing in drainage, land divisions, and road infrastructure projects
highlights: Construction supervision of road pavement and landfill projects
Full ownership of land division projects (from approval to design and construction)
Design of services (water, stormwater, sewer, road pavement, retaining walls, drainage)
Review and approval of engineering drawings

awards.title: Startup Weekend Adelaide
awards.summary: 2nd Place + Sponsors Choice, November 2012 - Help create an iOS app to find and rate the nearest public toilet.

awards.title: Cardinal Game Jam
awards.summary: Competed solo in a 24 hour game jam http://www.thecardinalgamejam.com/
